clinical_study.brief_title: Maternal Positioning and Occipitoposterior Fetal Position
clinical_study.official_title: Maternal Positioning to Correct Occipitoposterior Fetal Position in Labor: A Randomized Controlled Trial

collaborator.agency: University of Applied Sciences of Western Switzerland

brief_summary.textblock:
The aim of the study is to evaluate the efficacy of a specific maternal position to correct fetal position in occipito-posterior during the labor.
The investigators hypothesize that the maternal position described by the Dr de Gasquet facilitate the rotation in occipito-anterior during the labor.
The calculated sample size is 438 participants (219 in each group)

primary_outcome.measure: Fetal presentation after the intervention compare to control group
primary_outcome.time_frame: One hour after the randomization for the study
primary_outcome.description: Diagnosis of the fetal presentation will be measured by an ultra-sound one hour after the randomization in both groups: intervention and control

secondary_outcome.time_frame: During the hour after the randomization
secondary_outcome.description: Auto-administrated questionnaire to assess comfort of the maternal position and pain related to the labor, in intervention group and control group

arm_group.description: women allocated to intervention group will be invited to adopt a posture all fours type:"support on the knees, torso tilted forward, back stretched" for a minimum of 10 minutes. A cushion is placed between the legs of the woman to limit the cuts. According to Dr de Gasquet, author of the description of this posture, the effect on the variety of presentation would be almost immediate.
Not specific intervention for this group- Only usual care

intervention.intervention_name: Specific maternal position during the labor
intervention.description: women allocated to intervention group will be invited to adopt a posture all fours type:"support on the knees, torso tilted forward, back stretched" for a minimum of 10 minutes. A cushion is placed between the legs of the woman to limit the cuts.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- singleton
- primiparous and multiparous
- Term â‰¥ 37 weeks
- Labor in dilatation phase (cervix effaced, permeable finger 2 to 9 cm)
- Diagnosis of occipitoposterior variety confirmed by ultrasound
Exclusion Criteria:
- Maternal age below 18 years old
- Misunderstanding the French Language
- Full dilatation of the cervix
- Posture evaluated already adopted by the woman during labor
